Play:
Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees
(Yoshitsune senbonzakura / 義経千本桜)

Written By: Takeda Izumo, II (竹田出雲) , Miyoshi Shōraku (三好松洛) , Namiki Senryū (See also Namiki Namiki Sōsuke) (並木千柳)

First Staged: 1747

Reference: Traditional Japanese Theater: An Anthology of Plays, edited by Karen Brazell (New York: Columbia University Press, 1998); Kokuritsu Gekijō jōen shiryōshū, edited by Kokuritsu Gekijō Geinō Chōsashitsu, vol. 191, May 1981; Hironaga, Shūzaburō, The Bunraku Handbook (Tokyo: Maison des Arts, 1976); Bunraku May 1981 Performance Program

– Click image to view.

Performances:

April 1970: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

May 1970: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

April 1973: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

June 1974: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

April 1975: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

April 1978: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

May 1979: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

April 1980: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

May 1981: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

April 1983: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

April 1984: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

October 1984: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

July 1987: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

March 1989: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

December 1989 : Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

May 1988 Harajuku Bunraku: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

April 1990: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

September 1991: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

April 1995: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

April 1997: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

April 2001: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

March 1996 Tour: Yoshitsune and a Thousand Cherry Trees

Characters:

Tomokata Fujiwara (Fujiwara Tomokata / 藤原朝方)

Dainoshin Inokuma (Inokuma Dainoshin / 猪熊大之進)

Benkei (Musashibō Benkei / 武蔵坊弁慶)

Yoshitsune Minamoto (Minamotono Yoshitsune / 源義経(九郎判官源義経))

Wakaba-no-Naishi (Wakaba no naishi / 若葉の内侍)

Rokudai (Rokudai Gimi / 六代君)

Nun Joshin (Jōshin ni / 浄心尼)

Kokingo (Shume no Kokingo / 主馬の小金吾)

Kyo-no-Kimi (Kyo no Kimi / 卿の君)

Shizuka-Gozen (Shizuka Gozen / 静御前)

Rokuro Kamei (Kamei Rokurō / 亀井六郎)

Jiro Suruga (Surugano Jirō / 駿河次郎)

Taro Kawagoe (Kawagoe Tarō / 川越太郎 (鎌倉の使者川越太郎重頼 ))

Tosanobo (Tosanobō Shōzon / 土佐坊正尊)

Gonta (Igami no Gonta / いがみの権太)

Kosen, Gonta's wife (Gonta nyōbō Kosen / 権太女房小仙)

Zenta, Gonta's son (Gonta segare Zenta / 権太伜善太)

Yazaemon (Sushiya Yazaemon / すしや(親)弥左衛門)

Osato, Yazaemon's daughter (Musume Osato / 娘お里)

Yasuke, in fact Koremori (Yasuke jitsuwa Tairano Koremori / 弥助実は平維盛)

Yazaemon's wife (Yazaemon nyōbō / 弥左衛門女房)

Kagetoki Kajiwara (Kajiwara Kagetoki / 梶原景時)

Toda Hayami (Hayamino Tōda / 逸見藤太(土佐坊の郎党逸見の藤太))

Sato Tadanobu, in fact Fox Tadanobu (Satō Tadanobu jitsuwa Genkurō gitsune / 佐藤忠信実は源九郎狐 (狐忠信))

Tadanobu Sato (Satō Tadanobu / 佐藤忠信 (佐藤四郎兵衛忠信))

Gimpei, in fact Tomomori (Tokaiya Ginpei jitsuwa Chūnagon Tomomori / 渡海屋銀平実は中納言知盛)

Oyasu, in fact Emperor Antoku (Musume Oyasu jitsuwa Antoku Tennō / 娘お安実は安徳天皇)

Oryu, in fact Suke-no-Tsubone (Nyōbō Oriu jitsuwa Sukeno tsubone / 女房おりう実は典侍局)

Page (Kinju / 近習)

Goro (Sagami Gorō / 相模五郎)

Tanzo Irie (Irie Tanzō / 入江丹蔵)

Boatmen (Sendō / 船頭)

Kakuhan, in fact Noritsune (Yokawa Kakuhan jitsuwa Notonokami Noritsune / 横川禅師覚範実は能登守(平)教経)
